--- In junit@y..., "j3ca" <j3ca@y...> wrote:
> I'm thinking of using JUnit to test my applications. They rely 
> heavily on data from databases. How do I test a database 
application 
> whit JUnit where I can't change data in the database?

Take a look at mockobjects. You must invest some time in the testing, 
but after the investment you'll get a lot of advantages like faster 
testing and the ability to throw certain exceptions.

I recommend to read the following article:

http://www.mockobjects.com/papers/jdbc_testfirst.html 
on testing with mockobjects 
and
http://www.dallaway.com/acad/dbunit.html 
on testing with dbunit.

I am using the mockobjects approach right now, and I am very happy 
with it!

good luck,

Richard.
